attributes.action: Prevent sex offenders changing their legal name under which they were convicted.
attributes.background: A recent FOI request has proven that MORE than 800 sex offenders have changed their names to hide their crimes in the last 5 years, including 83 rapists and 126 perverts convicted of possessing or distributing child abuse images, and 88 were convicted of indecent assault and 44 of sexual assault.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/7138397/Sex-offenders-hide-and-change-their-name.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3582349/More-800-British-sex-offenders-changed-names-hide-dark-past-police-REFUSE-tell-protect-perverts-rights.html

attributes.action: Make taking pictures of children in public without carers consent illegal
attributes.background: My 3yr old neice was photographed at the beach by a stranger, she was specifically targeted, the man followed her around to take the pics, the police were called but because no crime had been commited the man walked free with his phone and there was an uncertainty as to whether the pics were deleted
attributes.additional_details:
Children are extremely vulnerable and I feel that by it being legal for strangers to target and photograph them, this puts them in an even more vulnerable state.
It should not be right for strangers to be allowed to have photographs of our children on their phones. This needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: All multiple occupancy premises must have a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.background:
Out of hospital cardiac arrests kill more people annually than fire does. 
Make it a legal requirement for all government and commercial multiple occupancy premises, having either a fixed or transitory population, to keep and maintain a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details: Fire Extinguishers are compulsory in many buildings; 2013-14 there were 322 fire-related deaths in the UK(Source: UK Gov) but it is estimated that there are about 60k out of hospital cardiac arrests in the UK annually. 30k are discovered in time to help save the victim’s life(Source: BHF). If response time for using defibrillators was shortened to within 8 minutes it would save the lives of 15 out of 100 people who collapse with cardiac arrest.(Source: Milan, Brescia and Washington Universities)

attributes.action: Introduce Helen’s Law where hiding a body becomes a criminal offence
attributes.background: To lose a loved one to murder is horrific. To be denied their funeral causes unimaginable suffering. Ian Simms is serving a life sentence for the murder of  Helen McCourt, aged 22, on 9 February 1988, in Billinge, Lancs. Simms has always refused to reveal the whereabouts of Helen’s body.
attributes.additional_details:
The case made legal history as only the third ever UK murder trial without a body and was one of the first in the UK to use DNA fingerprinting.

As it currently stands, the English legal system does not require a convicted murderer to admit guilt or reveal the location of a victim’s remains before being released. 

We hereby ask the government to acknowledge the pain and distress caused to the families of missing murder victims by:
1. Denying parole to murderers for as long as they refuse to disclose the whereabouts of their victim’s remains
2. Passing a full life tariff (denying parole or release) until the murderer discloses the location (and enables the recovery) of their victim’s remains

Denying a funeral is, surely, an infringement of basic human rights.

attributes.action: Stop taxing hard working people on their overtime. Tax on basic 40hrs only
attributes.background: Over time should be tax free as people don't want to do it but for most it's a must to help them live.

attributes.action: Allow Doctors to Issue Temporary Disabled Parking Badges
attributes.background: Many people leave hospital and are vulnerable and have extremely limited mobility. I believe GPs and Doctors should be able to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help people with temporary issues
attributes.additional_details:
Many people leave hospital have had invasive or life changing surgery and are signed off work for weeks or even moths to recover. During this time no provision is made to help them access shops, pharmacists or even hospitals!

I would like to empower Doctors to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help post operative patients rehabilitate.

These badges would give the bearer the same access rights as the current Disabled Badge scheme however they would expire as patients recover.

attributes.action: Ensure councils have adequate maintenance funding so Parkruns can remain free
attributes.background: Parkruns are free for people of all ages and abilities, providing benefits for health and the community. Stoke Gifford Parish Council have voted to charge Parkrun. Its free nature means many who otherwise wouldn't or can't participate have made positive impacts on their health and community
attributes.additional_details: Promoting health and exercise will save the government money on the NHS and help keep people healthy

attributes.action: The government must also put case for leaving the EU on it's referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: I believe that democracy should be fair and that this country should have an honest referendum on it's membership of the EU without the government using tax payers money to fund one side of the argument in a blatant attempt to sway voters to the remain side.
attributes.additional_details: The government is spending £9million on a referendum leaflet.

attributes.action: Ban mobile phones in the House
attributes.background: After seeing the reactions to the call for George Osborne to apologise all we can see from the Tory front bench is laughing at their mobile phones and texting. The use of mobile phones at work is generally banned and I think the same rule should stand in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygQykstDk2w

attributes.action: Ban the use of neonicotinoids in the UK
attributes.background: 37 MILLION BEES (600 HIVES) FOUND DEAD AFTER PLANTING LARGE GMO CORN FIELD TREATED WITH NEONICOTINOID CLASS OF PESTICIDES IN CANADA.
attributes.additional_details: http://jbanews.com/2016/02/27/37-million-bees-found-dead-after-planting-large-gmo-corn-field-treated-with-neonicotinoid-class-of-pesticides/

attributes.action: Free sanitary products in homeless centres and open clinics.
attributes.background: Having a period at home at the best of times isn't pleasant. Along with worrying about getting blood on clothing, women must battle cramps and a hormonal rollercoaster. Doing this as a homeless woman is far worse due to a lack in sanitary facilities and privacy.
attributes.additional_details:
We estimate that women spend around £5070 on their period between the ages of 12 and 51. 
In addition sanitary products are considered luxury items so are subject to an additional 5% tax. Mens razors are not included in this luxury tax. Considered that a women will use an average of 11,000 tampons (alone) in their lifetime, can this really be justified?

attributes.action: Scrap the UK honours system
attributes.background: The honours system is anachronistic and irrelevant cronyism. It is a largely elite structure rewarding randomly selected people who are merely doing their job (often badly). If it is replaced at all it should be by a people's panel recognising only public service and sacrifice.
attributes.additional_details: Examples too numerous to list, going back decades. The latest examples include Philip Green's peerage and David Cameron's resignation list.

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid - divert to, Health, Police, Military, and Pensioners
attributes.background: Foreign aid 11 billion budget to increase by £1 billion (That is money the UK Government borrows to give away).The UK  spends more than any other country and is the second largest aid donor in the world (The Telegraph)  Despite in 2015 UK government debt amounted to £1.56 trillion(economicshelp.org)
attributes.additional_details:
In January, it emerged that civil servants had gone on a £1billion spending spree over eight weeks last year to hit the government target of allocating 0.7 per cent of national income to overseas aid.
BRITAIN's spending on foreign aid will be LARGER than the entire Home Office budget in each of the next five years - reaching a staggering £16BILLION, it was revealed. Pakistan who is a Nuclear Power and not so long ago bought a fleet of fighters off the USA get the highest amount 351 million.

attributes.action: All lorries that come into Dover should be checked
attributes.background: Some lorries are allowed into the country without being checked for illegal immigrants or narcotics and this should not be the case. All lorries should be checked in order to reduce the amount of illegal immigrants that are allowed into the country.

attributes.action: Recognition of the Armenian Genocide
attributes.background: I would like HM Government to recognise the events that overtook the Armenian population [of what is now E Turkey] around 1915 as 'genocide'. HM Government to follow the lead of EU partners - such as France & Austria - who already recognise those events as 'genocide'.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of a parliamentary discussion, MPs should consider whether the terrible Jewish holocaust/genocide differs from that which overtook the Armenia population [of E Turkey] around 1915. Nearly two million innocent people were killed during those events.

Furthermore, why, since the Jewish genocide has been officially recognised by HM Government, is it the case that the Armenian genocide remains unacknowledged - given the criteria set down in the 1942 UN declaration on Genocide?

attributes.action: Scrap 20% VAT on memorial headstones and the service provided by memorial masons
attributes.background:
Recently my 5 year daughter 'fell asleep' and i was shocked to find out that VAT is applied on memorial headstones ,memorial vases etc. 
How is VAT allowed in the first place, could someone explain to me how its a value added tax when you lose someone suddenly and unexpectedly.
attributes.additional_details: Currently charities and faith groups are allowed to claim back VAT through the Memorial Grant Scheme so can this not be opened up to the general public or VAT not applied or together.

attributes.action: Simplify the motorcycle test
attributes.background: Since the implementation of directive 2006/126/EEC the UK motorcycle test has become unnecessarily complicated and prohibitively expensive.
attributes.additional_details: The closed circuit part of the test that ensures riding at 50 KMH is totally irrelevant. We wish to see a structured sensible test similar to the previous test that provided safe training and restricted access to powerful bikes for a short period as we believe this was the most successful version of motorcycle testing. We believe that structured training is preferable to complicated legislation as a way to reduce accidents.

attributes.action: Ban pre packed cooked bones being sold as dog treats
attributes.background:
Many dog owners are unaware of the dangers of giving their dog cooked bones. 
Lots of shops in the uk (not just pet shops) sell pre packed cooked bones as dog treats which are sold to dog owners everyday! Cooked bones can be deadly to dogs and many die every year because of this

attributes.action: Ban ALL religious advertising on public transport,
attributes.background:
The Lords Prayer was banned from cinemas, but a Muslim advert for their prophet was allowed on buses. This is discriminatory and unfair, 
and can be considered offensive to people who either have a different faith or no faith
attributes.additional_details: Therefore we the undersigned petitioners require the government to ban ALL religious advertising on public transport, including buses, taxis, trains and any other public transport,

attributes.action: Ban bonfires in residential areas between the hours of 600 and 1900 on weekdays
attributes.background: So many peoples lives are blighted by the indiscriminate starting of bonfires in residential areas

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cruel halal meat in the UK
attributes.background: Stop the cruel slaughter of innocent animals for halal meat. Stop the sale of halal meat in UK.

attributes.action: Include "Dog on Dog" Attacks in the Dangerous Dog Acts 1991
attributes.background:
Due to my own dog being injured in an unprovoked attack from another dog, I would like to have "dog on dog" attacks include in the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991. 
Any dog that is injured or harmed in an unprovoked attack from another dog should be a criminal offence due to irresponsible ownership.
attributes.additional_details:
Photographic evidence from the attack is available, a report from the veterinary clinic can be requested, and witness statements. 
The incident was reported to the police and has been logged. 
This attack was clearly vicious and distressing to ourselves and the dog, and was completely unprovoked. 
As responsible pet owners, our dog was on a lead and wearing a muzzle, unable to defend himself in the attack.

attributes.action: Make all foreign vehicles entering the UK pay a road tax.
attributes.background: When we drive across the channel we are expected to pay road tax in many European countries, either by way of motorway tolls, or by purchasing a vignette.  However, any vehicle can enter the UK from Europe and are able to travel free of road tax.  Why is this allowed to carry on?
attributes.additional_details: Vignettes could be purchased at the port of entry, or on line, in much the same way as the purchase system on the borders of Switzerland and Austria.  In Switzerland we have to purchase an annual vignette, and in Austria we are able to purchase a three month vignette.  Our roads are crammed with foreign trucks, and I strongly believe that some form of British road tax should be levied to ease the burden of the high road repair costs.

attributes.action: Make spitting of Paan in public places a Civil offence.
attributes.background: Paan is a preparation combining betel leaf with areca nut and sometimes also with tobacco.It is chewed for its stimulant and psychoactive effects.
attributes.additional_details: Paan made with areca nut and lime, with or without tobacco, causes profuse red coloured salivation.This saliva is spat, yielding stains and biological waste pollution in public spaces. Many countries and municipalities have laws to prevent paan spit.Health effects of chewing paan: gum damage, tooth decay and oral cancer.

attributes.action: Dissolve Parliament after leadership elections to trigger a General Election
attributes.background: I believe that no public mandate exists for the incumbent government and the period of government following the EU referendum is too important to proceed without such a mandate.

attributes.action: Demand the EU accounts are fully disclosed. Not been audited in 20 years.
attributes.background: The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/did-auditors-sign-eu-budget/

Let's see the accounts and let 'our' auditors have a look at them.  Make things open and transparent.  Or isn't that allowed in the EU?

attributes.action: Enforce senior drivers to re-take their driving test
attributes.background: Lots of senior drivers didn't have to sit a formal driving test and even more didn't have to sit one that was adequate. It should be a legal requirement for drivers at the age of 70 to re-sit a upto date driving test that they desperately need. This would improve the safety of roads in general

attributes.action: Ban all Non Biodegradable packaging from being used
attributes.background:
Not only does the burning of fossil fuels pollute the air we breath, and slowly raise the sea levels adding more and more fresh water slowly desalinated them.
Likewise the use of plastics in packaging is another huge risk to the oceans as it poisons or strangles the marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
widely 'over' used to replace glass or other natural biodegradables.
Thousands of tonnes get into our oceans every year, which poisons any marine life around them.
While in the sea it simply gets broken into smaller chunks, now easily consumable by all marine life
We then eat these animals unwittingly POISONING ourselves.
Everyone hates trying to tear or cut through these types of packing anyway, so let's get rid of them!
We need to be more careful with our planet or we will lose it!

attributes.action: Abolish the puppy trade
attributes.background: Recently seen visual images regarding how dogs are held captive and bread in small cages in order to be sold on the high street. Dogs should not be sold or treated this way. I want action because animal cruelty should not be acceptable in any circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary by the BBC called 'Britain's Puppy Dealers: exposed' illustrated real examples of dog dealers and how dogs and puppies are left in small cages without heat, food or any air holes, and how small puppies were dumped on the side of the road because they were either dead or not up to standard. This type of evidence illustrates why this needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Bring Leasehold Housing into the Commonhold and Leasehold Reform Act 2002
attributes.background: There is a gap within the legislation to protect Leasehold Housing in the same way that leasehold flats are protected. Without that protection, management companies & maintenance companies can abuse the current system. House buyers need to be protected against escalating and unreasonable fees!
attributes.additional_details: If Leasehold Housing were brought into the current legislation leaseholders could gather together & form a committee and have the option to change the company or a Right to Manage. If Leasehold Housing stays outside the parameters of this legislation the only option leaseholders have is to go to a tribunal to challenge charges & if found guilty the company still cannot be replaced.Protection is required to regulate leasehold housing especially as many sites are now building on a leasehold basis.

attributes.action: Make the North East Combined Authority give the people a vote on Devolution
attributes.background:
SUNDERLAND COUNCIL LEADER PAUL WATSON HAS TOLD THE NEWCASTLE CHRONICLE WE THE PUBLIC DON’T WANT A VOTE ON DEVOLUTION 
HE SEEMS TO HAVE FORGOTTEN WE HAVE ALREADY VOTED ON DEVOLUTION IN 2004 AND IT WAS A MASSIVE MAJORITY TO REJECT DEVOLUTION

attributes.action: Allow all people diagnosed with an ASC to access concessionary travel passes
attributes.background: The law as it stands regarding concessionary travel passes is discriminatory and outdated. For people with an Autistic Spectrum Condition there is a postcode lottery of access depending on their local council's definition of a "learning disability". This discrepancy must be resolved.
attributes.additional_details: The DSMv (diagnostic standards manual) effectively did away with the distinctions that had previously been drawn between autistic spectrum conditions. For several years now the standard diagnosis is for ASC and IQ is no longer routinely tested. This means that children are unable to meet the criteria for concessionary travel, despite their genuine social and sensory difficulties in accessing public transport. The guidelines must be updated.

attributes.action: UK government must remain committed to the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We, the undersigned believe that The European Convention on Human Rights should be accepted as the minimum standard for Human Rights in the UK with the European Court of Human Rights as the final arbiter.
attributes.additional_details: If Human Rights are defined solely by the UK government then Human Rights can be removed from any group unpopular with that government at any time. The European Convention on Human Rights is designed to protect us from oppressive governments and its importance and necessity have not disappeared.

attributes.action: Make the result of debates triggered by these Petitions binding on Government.
attributes.background: Government's response to the 2nd Referendum Petition, which has gained over 4 million signatures, let slip that any debate triggered by it would have no legal force. We may be wasting our time participating in these petitions unless that changes.
attributes.additional_details:
I quote as evidence this, taken from the initial response to the 2nd Referendum petition:
'The Committee wishes to make clear that, although it may choose to schedule a debate on this petition in due course, it only has the power to schedule debates in Westminster Hall – the second debating chamber of the House of Commons. Debates in Westminster Hall do not have the power to change the law, and could not trigger a second referendum.'

attributes.action: A Gen Election before Article 50, free of first past the post for EU membership.
attributes.background:
We dispute the EU referendum result; due to numbers against and that the Leave Campaign substantially misled the Electorate.  

Both Conservatives and Labour have promised to enforce the vote.  This promise blocks at least 48% of the Electorate from revisiting this issue in elections due (cont)
attributes.additional_details:
(cont) to the first past the post rule violating almost half of the UK’s democratic rights.

We demand a general election free of the first past the post rule to determine EU membership prior to invoking Article 50, so as to give the maximum number of the British people a voice in their country's future.

http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/26/eu-referendum-brexit-vote-leave-iain-duncan-smith-nhs

Cameron and Corbyn are on record as respecting the referendum result to exit the EU.

attributes.action: Invest more money to fund Chronic fatigue syndrome  / M.E treatment.
attributes.background:
The main symptom of CFS is persistent physical and mental fatigue (exhaustion). This doesn't go away with sleep or rest and limits your usual activities.
Most people with CFS describe this fatigue as overwhelming and a different type of tiredness from what they've experienced before please sign
attributes.additional_details:
.
People with severe CFS are unable to do any activities themselves or can only carry out simple daily tasks, such as brushing their teeth. They're sometimes confined to their bed and are often unable to leave their house. 
There are other common symptoms as well as severe fatigue
CFS is a serious condition that can cause long-term illness and disability, It's estimated around 250,000 people in the UK have CFS.
There is currently NO treatment for this at all! Please sign

attributes.action: Make ABP and other former public sector bodies protect historic buildings.
attributes.background: Grimsby was once the largest fishing port in the world.  Associated British Ports (ABP) is demolishing the 19th century buildings at the heart of the historic port of Grimsby.  ABP have permitted development rights - no planning application is needed.
attributes.additional_details: ABP was formerly the British Transport Docks Board.  Other industries formerly in the public sector have legal duties to consider historic buildings (e.g. in Water Industry Act 1991, section 3 and Electricity Act 1989, Schedule 9).  The law should be changed so that ABP (and other bodies formerly in the public sector) are subject to similar duties.

attributes.action: Patient centered treatment for pernicious anemia/ b12 injections.
attributes.background: People with b12 deficiency have quarterly b12 injections most patients feel this is not regular enough and despite asking doctors you have to wait 3 months and have to feel the ill effects this gives people, which is linked to a lot of further health problems.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2191161/The-60p-injection-boost-flagging-energy.html

attributes.action: Block Scotland spending another £14M of British money on another referendum.
attributes.background: The last referendum cost the British taxpayer £14M. If we come out of the EU, they are citing doing this again. They've already said no once, we cant waste another £14M on this again.

attributes.action: Gerard Batten, to lead the delegation negotiating terms for leaving the EU
attributes.background: Before I decided on this petition I spoke to five Conservative friends and three Socialist friends who were all for Leaving, and they said they could support my idea.
attributes.additional_details:
There are huge pitfalls if the Leave campaign wins the referendum. Article50 is the worst, the Norwegian and Swiss options are not necessary for the fifth strongest economy in the world.

Mr Batten has written an excellent book ”The Road to Freedom: How Britain Can Escape the EU” showing the traps and tricks that Article50 invokes so that we could be kept in each 'two year period' indefinitely. As Nigel Farage is a little like Marmite (people either love him or hate him) Mr Batten would be an ideal replacement.

attributes.action: Stop charging for school meals and give all school children a free meal!
attributes.background:
Children's parents are having to pay around £2.50 per day for a school meal. Some schools are even charging parents to bring in packed lunches!
This is wrong on so many levels. Prisoners don't have to pay for meals so why should children pay in a system we at taxes for anyway!

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd as home secretary
attributes.background: We the 17 million who voted to leave,have no confidence in amber rudd as home secretary..Her performance during the debates was appalling and very childish..We expect a brexit home secretary asap.Who will deliver what we have asked for and will be fit for the job.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa may must accept and do the will of the undersigned ..We should of had a vote for who runs our government.

attributes.action: Make Government time immediately available to repeal Expats 15 year voting limit
attributes.background: In the recent Referendum vote, many British subjects were prevented from voting on a matter which could potentially affect their lives because they have lived and worked abroad for more than 15 years. Government time is needed in Parliament immediately to enable a promise by David Cameron to be kept
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon David Cameron recently stated that there was an intention to repeal this limit but no time was available before the Referendum. Since the "Leave" vote will compel a new programme of legislation when Parliament returns after Recess an opportunity exists to progress this. A Bill was introduced by Geoffrey Clifton-Brown MP in 2014 but failed for lack of time despite strong Conservative support. This should be immediately reintroduced in Government time not by a Private Member

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens who are resident in the UK to vote in any future UK referendum
attributes.background: In the recent 2016 UK referendum, EU citizens that had been living AND working in the UK for more than 5 years were unable to vote on a referendum that would directly affect their lives. These people are net contributors, both economically and socially to the UK and should not be devalued.

attributes.action: Allow tax-paying UK residents to vote in general elections and referendums
attributes.background:
Excluding tax paying immigrants from the voting population makes the vote less representative of the will of the UK because it silences a very important part of the engine of the country.
Let's make sure going forward all the people who love and work hard for this country have a say in its future.

attributes.action: Reconsider changing bursaries to loans for Student Nurses and Midwives.
attributes.background: The government has recently voted to remove the NHS Bursary for Student Nurses and Midwives. Student Nurses and midwives work 37.5 per hours a week on placement, they should not have to pay for the privilege of becoming nurses, when they already work for that money!

attributes.action: Do not allow universities to raise tuition fees from £9000 to the proposed £9250
attributes.background: Universities announce fees above £9,000 limit - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-36845106

attributes.action: Call a General Election that allows 16-17 year old people to vote.
attributes.background: The next PM is unelected this is not democratic, an election should have happened when Gordon Brown took office don't allow this to happen again. 16 and 17 year olds are competent and understand that their vote can make a difference and so should be allowed to vote.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/votes-at-16
http://www.voteat16.ie/nine_reasons
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/lord-wallace/eu-referendum-young-voters_b_8280774.html

After all a 16-year-old in Britain can get married, pay tax and join the army, so why on earth should they not be allowed to take part in the democratic process, especially when it involves a decision that greatly affects them?

attributes.action: Give all 16 and 17 year olds the vote in referenda that affect their future
attributes.background: In the June 2016 referendum on whether to remain in the UK, 16 and 17 year old citizens have been denied a say on this important question, yet will endure its consequences for the next 60 to 70 years. Their fate has been decided by older people who have less at stake. This is morally wrong.
